Room.Name: Lake Kista East Shore
Room.ShortDescription: You are wading at the mouth of the Sunshine River, a river known for its bone chilling waters. The river empties into the east side of Lake Kista.
Room.LongDescription: Hunting and fishing parties have been here in the past, and you see the remains of a beach camp fire near some large sheltering rocks near the mouth of the river. Looking out over the water you can see where the cold river water continues for quite a ways out into the lake, before it spreads into the lake proper. Funny how waters of two different temperatures seem to avoid each other.
